author: Jonathan Cooke
text: I raised a query and received a fast, comprehensive response so I proceeded to purchase an item that I had previously been bidding on. A few days later I received an email stating the item had arrived at StockX to be checked. A week passed with no further updates so I looked on the website and was disappointed to discover that the item had not passed the verification process. Their online help section states that, if this happens, they try and match the winning bid with another seller; however, I subsequently received an email stating that they will be refunding my money within 3-7 working days. Whilst the initial customer support I received was excellent, clearly they have not followed company procedure as there are now several of the same item listed on the website for considerably less than what I was prepared to pay. Whilst I appreciate that it’s not their fault that the item couldn’t be verified, they have missed an opportunity to shift a different sellers’ item for quite a bit more than the current listed price. I am now praying that the refund is processed in a timely manner as I have seen the same item offered for sale elsewhere and it would be a shame to miss out twice!
title: The good, the bad and the ugly
